visualization_prompt: Create a Highcharts chartOptions object to render a line chart with the following specifications: Chart type: line, Chart title: Monthly Average Temperature, Axes and labels styling: Use a dark gray color (#333) for axis labels and titles, with a font size of 14px. Data series: Provide data for a single series named 'Temperature', with values corresponding to the average temperature for each month. Custom colors: Use a gradient from blue to red for the line series. Additional configurations: Set the chart margins, background, and legend as specified in the JavaScript code.
visualization_explanation: The provided Highcharts chartOptions object is configured to render a line chart titled 'Monthly Average Temperature'. The chart type is set to 'line', and the x-axis categories represent the months from January to December. The y-axis title is 'Temperature (°C)', and both axis labels are styled with a dark gray color and a font size of 14px. The tooltip displays the series name and the temperature for each month. The data series is named 'Temperature' and includes the average temperature values for each month. The line series uses a gradient color from blue to red, enhancing the visual representation of the temperature changes throughout the year. Additional configurations include setting the chart's border and plot border widths, as well as the bottom margin to ensure sufficient space for the x-axis labels.
